events.originalText: A boat carrying migrants from Libya to Italy sank off the Italian island of Lampedusa, resulting in more than 360 deaths.
events.subtitle: 2013 Lampedusa migrant shipwreck
events.headline: Boat carrying migrants sinks off Italian island of Lampedusa, over 360 dead

events.originalText: The Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008, establishing the Troubled Asset Relief Program, commonly referred to as a bailout of the U.S. financial system, was enacted.
events.subtitle: Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008
events.headline: Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 establishes Troubled Asset Relief Program

events.originalText: Roy Horn of the American entertainment duo Siegfried & Roy was mauled by a tiger during a performance at the Mirage on the Las Vegas Strip.
events.subtitle: Siegfried & Roy
events.headline: Roy Horn of Siegfried & Roy mauled by tiger in Las Vegas

events.originalText: Nadine Gordimer became the first South African to win the Nobel Prize in Literature.
events.subtitle: Nadine Gordimer
events.headline: Nadine Gordimer first South African to win Nobel Prize in Literature

events.originalText: Major Moisés Giroldi of the Panama Defense Forces failed in his attempt to overthrow dictator Manuel Noriega.
events.subtitle: Moisés Giroldi
events.headline: Major Moisés Giroldi fails in overthrow attempt of Manuel Noriega

events.originalText: A hunger strike by Irish republican prisoners at HM Prison Maze outside Belfast, Northern Ireland, ended after seven months and ten deaths.
events.subtitle: 1981 Irish hunger strike
events.headline: Hunger strike by Irish republican prisoners at HM Prison Maze ends after 7 months, 10 deaths

events.originalText: Oswaldo López Arellano replaced Honduran president Ramón Villeda Morales  in a violent coup, initiating two decades of military rule.
events.subtitle: Oswaldo López Arellano
events.headline: Oswaldo López Arellano replaces Honduran president in violent coup

events.originalText: Mercury-Atlas 8, the fifth United States crewed space mission, was launched from Cape Canaveral Air Force Station in Florida, carrying astronaut Wally Schirra (pictured).
events.subtitle: Mercury-Atlas 8
events.headline: Mercury-Atlas 8 launched from Cape Canaveral with astronaut Wally Schirra

events.originalText: Vancouver's Holy Rosary Cathedral was dedicated by Archbishop William Mark Duke, fifty-three years after it first opened.
events.subtitle: Holy Rosary Cathedral (Vancouver)
events.headline: Vancouver's Holy Rosary Cathedral dedicated by Archbishop William Mark Duke

events.originalText: The United Kingdom successfully completed a nuclear test, becoming the world's third state with nuclear weapons.
events.subtitle: Operation Hurricane
events.headline: United Kingdom successfully completes nuclear test, third state with nuclear weapons

events.originalText: In Major League Baseball, the New York Giants' Bobby Thomson hit the "Shot Heard 'Round the World", a game-winning home run, to win the National League pennant.
events.subtitle: Major League Baseball
events.headline: Bobby Thomson hits 'Shot Heard 'Round the World' to win National League pennant

events.originalText: The First Battle of Maryang-san, widely regarded as one of the Australian Army's greatest accomplishments during the Korean War, began.
events.subtitle: First Battle of Maryang-san
events.headline: First Battle of Maryang-san begins during Korean War

events.originalText: American author Edgar Allan Poe was found semi-conscious and delirious in Baltimore, Maryland, under mysterious circumstances; it was the last time he was seen in public before his death four days later.
events.subtitle: Edgar Allan Poe
events.headline: Edgar Allan Poe found semi-conscious in Baltimore before death

events.originalText: Spanish forces departed Valdivia to suppress the indigenous Huilliche uprising in southern Chile.
events.subtitle: Valdivia
events.headline: Spanish forces depart Valdivia to suppress Huilliche uprising in Chile

events.originalText: Anglo-Spanish War: An English fleet intercepted and attacked six Spanish ships at the Battle of the Narrow Seas (depicted).
events.subtitle: Anglo-Spanish War (1585–1604)
events.headline: English fleet intercepts and attacks Spanish ships at Battle of the Narrow Seas

events.originalText: Mu­ham­mad VII became the twelfth sultan of the Emirate of Granada.
events.subtitle: Muhammad VII of Granada
events.headline: Mu­ham­mad VII becomes twelfth sultan of Emirate of Granada
